extract.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
extract.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
He extracted an envelope from his inside pocket.
extract.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to carefully remove a substance from something which contains it, using a machine, chemical process etc
extract.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Oils are extracted from the plants.
extract.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to get something which you want from someone, such as information, money, help etc, especially when they do not want to give it to you
extract.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: They used torture to extract information about their families.
She had extracted a promise from him.
extract.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to take information or a short piece of writing from a book
extract.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: We need to extract the relevant financial data.
extract.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to get an advantage or good thing from a situation
extract.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: They aim to extract the maximum political benefit from the Games.
extract.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc
extract.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
extract.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a substance obtained from something by using a special process
extract.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Add one teaspoon of vanilla extract.
extract.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to remove RAW MATERIALs, such as gold or oil, from a place, for example the sea or the ground, so that they can be sold or used in an industrial or manufacturing process
extract.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The landowner has appealed for planning permission to extract the peat.
The three most heavily taxed commodities are alcohol, tobacco, and the oil being extracted from the North Sea.
extract.translation[2].definitions[1].de: to separate a substance or chemical from RAW MATERIALs
extract.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The roots are crushed in the local sugar factory to extract the sugary juice.
Cocoa butter and cocoa powder are extracted from the beans.
extract.translation[2].definitions[2].de: to get information or facts from a piece of writing or set of figures
extract.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: The software extracts data directly from the accounting system.
He would not leave until he’d extracted every detail.
extract.translation[2].definitions[3].de: to get information or an agreement from someone, although it is difficult to do so
extract.translation[2].definitions[3].ex: The full employment of the 1950s gave trade unions the power to extract better terms and conditions from employers.
extract.translation[3].definitions[0].de: a small part of a piece of writing, music, or a film
extract.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: an extract from a memorandum to a US delegate
extract.translation[3].definitions[1].de: a substance or chemical which has been removed from RAW MATERIALs
